meanings.definition: To set or establish boundaries or limits
meanings.sent1: The teacher was demarcating the play area for the students.
meanings.sent2: The demarcating lines on the map showed where the property ended.
meanings.sent3: The demarcating of the cake into equal slices made everyone happy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile demarcated the joy on her face.
meanings.sent5: The demarcating of the finish line with colorful flags made it easy to spot.

meanings.sent1: The fence was demarcating the garden from the rest of the yard.
meanings.sent2: The demarcating colors of the flowers made them stand out in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The demarcating of the twins by their different hairstyles confused their friends.
meanings.sent4: His loud voice demarcated him from the quiet crowd.
meanings.sent5: The demarcating smell of fresh bread filled the kitchen.
